Name: Bondcord
Details: A woven bracelet worn around the right wrist of the bondsman, the bondcord consisted of three colored strands. The color and pattern of the cords signified which Clan and unit had captured the warrior, while each cord represented three different virtues: combat talent, integrity, and loyalty. Whenever the bondholder felt the bondsman had sufficiently demonstrated one of these virtues, they would cut the associating cord. Once the final cord was cut, the bondsman was freed and reinstated into the new Clan's warrior caste as an abtakha.
